title: The Reflexion process

definitions.Agent: The entity that performs actions and receives feedback
definitions.Self-reflection (LM): A process where the agent evaluates its own performance
definitions.Evaluator (LM): A component that assesses the agent's actions
definitions.Trajectory (short-term memory): The agent's short-term memory of its actions
definitions.Experience (long-term memory): The agent's long-term memory of its experiences
definitions.Actor (LM): The component that executes the agent's actions
definitions.Environment: The external context in which the agent operates
definitions.Obs / Reward: Observation and reward from the environment
definitions.External feedback: Feedback from the environment to the agent

summary: The Reflexion process diagram illustrates the components and flow of information within an agent's decision-making process. It includes the agent's interaction with the environment, the role of self-reflection, and the distinction between short-term and long-term memory. The diagram also shows how actions are influenced by observations and rewards from the environment.
